title: Designing Educational Achievement Structures in Inclusive Higher Education: UDL (Universal Design for Learning)-Based Teacher Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: VR-based practical training environment to strengthen pre-/in-service teachers' competency in designing inclusive educational outcomes for diverse learner needs

learning_goals: Learners can design educational outcome structures that accommodate diverse learner types by applying Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles.
Learners can develop inclusivity-based assessment tools (rubrics) in simulation environments and apply them to project-based evaluations.
Learners can implement personalized feedback strategies for each learner in blended reality (VR/simulation) learning scenarios utilizing Bring Your Own Device (BYOD).

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device)-compatible educational apps/tools
UDL (Universal Design for Learning) guidelines and case study compendium

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
